body: Nice idea.  Might be a bit of work.  I wonder if there are any Go frameworks about to help?

A bit of research comes up with
- https://github.com/sanbornm/go-selfupdate
- https://github.com/inconshreveable/go-update
I wish I could help you in here
Sorry all. I was wrong when I closed this in favor of #3269. I can see now that that ticket actually requests automatic update feature. Sorry for noise. Reopening.

I'd like to quote https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/3269#issuecomment-502997308 which better fits in this ticket, I think

> Great idea! I'd like to emulate `restic self-update` which seems to work really well.

rename.from: request: Update bin from command line.

issue.title: Update/upgrade option

milestone.title: Help Wanted
milestone.description:
Enhancements which might be useful, but currently aren't planned.

Any help doing these much appreciated.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
It would be cool if rclone had an update/upgrade option, eg `rclone upgrade` would pull in the latest stable release and replace the current rclone binary and do any necessary cleanups automagicly (seamless experience)

Perhaps also throw in an option for latest beta release? `rclone upgrade --beta`

An simple and nice thing to have :smile:

body:
A quote of the idea of https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/2867#issuecomment-450499371 with minor edits:

`rclone self-update  --check` will just tell you if rclone needs updating!

I think the algorithm can look like:
- check whether self executable is writable by process user id (there may be windows specific tricks)
- if not writable, ask to rerun as _root_ (Administrator)
- parse https://downloads.rclone.org/version.txt
- parse [https://downloads.rclone.org/[VERSION]/SHA1SUMS](https://downloads.rclone.org/v1.54.0/SHA1SUMS)
- download architecture-compatible zip into `/tmp` from [https://downloads.rclone.org/[VERSION]/](https://downloads.rclone.org/v1.54.0)
- validate hash
- extract executable into self binary directory with temporary suffix (not to `/tmp`, to ensure atomicity of name swap  below)
- clone permissions from original to new binary, warn but continue in case of errors
- atomically swap name (similar to `mv -f` on Unix, I expect trickery on Windows)

What will NOT be implemented by this ticket:
- any kind of `--stable`  vs `--edge` flag -- rclone site currently provides only one `version.txt` with single line and I don't want to introduce fragile version number heuristics
- detection of whether current binary was installed directly, via package or via `install.sh` -- any such detection will be fragile, it will _not ease_ maintenance
- `.deb`, `.rpm`, etc package install -- this ticket is only about binary, I want to keep things simple, do not duplicate `apt-get install` or `yum install`
- auto self update -- it's probably enough to add `rclone self-update`  into unix cron, windows task scheduler, or whatever will be implemented by #3269
- package repositories have their dedicated requests #136 #2153

Todo: use reference ideas from:
- https://github.com/restic/restic/blob/master/cmd/restic/cmd_self_update.go
- https://github.com/restic/restic/tree/master/internal/selfupdate
